Class CalcStats

  • java.lang.Object
    • CalcStats

  • public class CalcStats
extends java.lang.Object
    This program allows the user to view the stats of baseball teams in each specified league and/or view the overall standings in the American and national leagues as many times as they would like, unless they choose to quit. For individual leagues, users will see stats related to wins, losses, win percentage, and games behind the best team in the league. For overall standing in all leagues, users will see win and loss records of each team, which are listed in descending order by win percentage.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CalcStats

        public CalcStats()

    • Method Detail

      • printWelcome

        public static void printWelcome()
        This function prints a welcome banner with a description of the program.

      • showMenuAndGetChoice

        public static int showMenuAndGetChoice(java.util.Scanner sc)
        This function presents a menu with 8 choices to the user and returns the integer of their choice. Note: the user will repeatedly be presented with the menu of options until they enter a integer within the range 1-8.
        Parameters:
        sc - The scanner object used to read user's choice
        Returns:
        The integer user chooses

      • calcWinPercentage

        public static double calcWinPercentage(java.lang.String line)
        This function calculates the win percentage of a single team.
        Parameters:
        line - The string consisting of name of team, number of wins, and number of losses separated by tab
        Returns:
        The percentage of games won as a double

      • calcGamesBehind

        public static double calcGamesBehind(java.lang.String line,
                                     int bestWin,
                                     int bestLoss)
        This function calculates how many games the given team is behind the best team in the league. Essentially, it measures the average difference between wins and losses of the given team vs. the first (best) team.
        Parameters:
        line - The String consisting of name of team, number of wins, and number of losses separated by tab
        bestWin - The integer value of the team who won the most games
        bestLoss - The integer value of the team who lost the least games
        Returns:
        The amount of games behind as a double

      • printStats

        public static void printStats(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> teams)
        This function prints the stats of a single league in a nicely ordered fashion with a header on top. The stats for each team include: number of wins, number of losses, win percentage, and amount of games behind.
        Parameters:
        teams - The array list of teams in chosen league

      • insertByWinPercentage

        public static void insertByWinPercentage(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> allTeams,
                                         java.lang.String line)
        This function compares the win percentage of each team in the text file and orders teams from greatest to least win percentage.
        Parameters:
        allTeams - The array list of all teams in text file
        line - The string consisting of name of team, number of wins, and number of losses separated by tab

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main function that executes whichever option the user chooses (user can choose to see stats of teams within each league or overall standings in American and national leagues) continuously until user enters an 8 to quit. This function also sets up arrays of teams by league, as well as an array of all teams in text file after reading said file.
